Uses of Class
org.cojen.tupl.repl.ReplicatorConfig

  • Packages that use ReplicatorConfig 
    Package Description
    org.cojen.tupl
    See Database to get started with Tupl.
    org.cojen.tupl.repl
    General-purpose Raft-based replication system, intended for supporting fully replicated databases.

    • Uses of ReplicatorConfig in org.cojen.tupl

      Methods in org.cojen.tupl with parameters of type ReplicatorConfig 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      DatabaseConfig DatabaseConfig.replicate​(ReplicatorConfig config)
      Enable replication using the given configuration.

    • Uses of ReplicatorConfig in org.cojen.tupl.repl

      Methods in org.cojen.tupl.repl that return ReplicatorConfig 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.addSeed​(String addressString)
      Add a remote member address for allowing the local member to join the group.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.addSeed​(String hostname, int port)
      Add a remote member address for allowing the local member to join the group.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.addSeed​(SocketAddress addr)
      Add a remote member address for allowing the local member to join the group.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.baseFile​(File file)
      Set the base file name for the replicator, which must reside in an ordinary file directory.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.baseFilePath​(String path)
      Set the base file name for the replicator, which must reside in an ordinary file directory.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.clone()  
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.createFilePath​(boolean mkdirs)
      Set true to create the directory for the replication files, if it doesn't already exist.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.eventListener​(BiConsumer<Level,​String> listener)
      Set a listener which receives notifications of actions being performed by the replicator.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.groupToken​(long groupToken)
      Set a unique group identifier, which acts as a simple security measure to prevent different replication groups from communicating with each other.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.listenAddress​(SocketAddress addr)
      Optionally restrict the socket address for accepting connections, which can be a wildcard address.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.localAddress​(SocketAddress addr)
      Set the local member socket address and port.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.localPort​(int port)
      Set the local member socket port, for accepting connections on any address.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.localRole​(Role role)
      Set the desired local member role, which is normal by default, and for the primoridal group member.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.localSocket​(ServerSocket ss)
      Explicitly specify a connected local socket, intended only for testing.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.proxyWrites​(boolean proxy)
      Pass true to proxy writes from the leader, reducing load on the leader, but increasing commit latency a bit.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.serverSocketFactory​(ServerSocketFactory factory)
      Set a factory for creating new server-side sockets.
      ReplicatorConfig ReplicatorConfig.socketFactory​(SocketFactory factory)
      Set a factory for creating new client-side sockets.
      Methods in org.cojen.tupl.repl with parameters of type ReplicatorConfig 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static DatabaseReplicator DatabaseReplicator.open​(ReplicatorConfig config)
      Open a replicator instance, creating it if necessary.
      static MessageReplicator MessageReplicator.open​(ReplicatorConfig config)
      Open a MessageReplicator instance, creating it if necessary.
      static StreamReplicator StreamReplicator.open​(ReplicatorConfig config)
      Open a StreamReplicator instance, creating it if necessary.
